hanzi-su-wiki:
轄

Значения

Управлять

Мнемоника

Чека. Вывалится — принесёт принести вред 害 всей телеге 車, если вывалится.

Варианты

辖
purpleculture_pinyin:
xiá
to govern; to control; having jurisdiction over; linchpin of a wheel (archaic); noise of a barrow
управлять; контролировать; юрисдикция над; стержень колеса (архаика); шум тачки
rtega_mnemonic:
轄轄RS
辖辖		linchpin of wheel, control, govern
  • cart 車 with soldiers controlling harm 害 being done to people
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 辖)
Pictophonetic: 害 indicates the sound; 車 (cart) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples: 轄區 [ xiá qū ]: administrative region
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 車 [ chē ] cart, vehicle; to move in a cart
    • 害 [ hài ] to injure, to harm; to destroy, to kill
heisig_chinese_memo: You can cause harm by losing control of your car. That's why governments administer licenses for driving.
heisig_constituent: control, car, harm, mansion, house, grow up, mouth
heisig_story: Car . . . harm. Hint: the image of an auto going "out of control" may help keep this key word distinct from others like it, such as manipulate (Frame 864).
koohiiStory1: The roads are icy, and a whole bunch of cars have spun out of control! Luckily, it was just a couple of dents; nobody was harmed.
koohiiStory2: Control is very important! Especially when operating a car. Few people realize the harm they can cause just by losing control of their car for a second. Tremendous harm. Stay in control!
WaniKani_Radicals: 車, 宀, 生, 口
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: When you drive a car, everyone under your roof is putting their life in your hands, even if they don't say it with their mouth—it's still under your control.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: It's really important to remember how many things are under your control when you operate a vehicle. It isn't just the people in your car either, it's everyone and everything in your way too.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You have to maintain control of your car or you'll hit a bunch of cats (かつ). The roads are full of cats at all times. And if you lose control of your car for just a second, you'll hit at least two or three cats.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: If you don't want to think about hitting adorable cats with your car, you better maintain control. You're responsible!

Ru_Radicals: 亠 (крышка), 口 (рот), 土 (земля), 宀 (значок У), 車 (автомобиль)
Ru_trainchinese:
xiá: (глаг) иметь в ведении, управлять
xiá: (графема) чека (на оси колеса)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: a damaged (害) car (車) is difficult to control
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: If you know how to administer control over the car, you will be safe from harm.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " car ", the sound of " harm " indicates that the metal keys at both ends of the axle are used to block the wheels. "Zuo Zhuan‧ Ai Gong Three Years": "School people ride on horses, caring for cars."

" Administration " also refers to the metal key on the shaft end of the fishing rod. The Southern Dynasties Liang Liu Xiaochuo's "Fishing Rod Article": "Golden Juyu Net, Silver Hook Jade Rod."

" Jurisdiction " also means jurisdiction and control. "The History of the Old Five Dynasties‧The Book of Zhou‧Lu Wenji Biography": "The official branch office of the time was in Luo. Although there were official historians in Taiwan, most of the Ji Gang did not purge, so the edict ordered the prosecution."

" Ju " also means the sound of cars. "Said Wen": "The sound of the car. From the car, the sound is bad. One said: Jurisdiction, key."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " car ", the sound of " harm " indicates that the metal keys at both ends of the axle are used to block the wheels.
humanum_full_description:
從「車」，「害」聲，表示車軸兩頭的金屬鍵，用以擋住車輪。《左傳‧哀公三年》：「校人乘馬，巾車脂轄。」

　　「轄」也指魚竿釣輪軸端的金屬鍵。南朝梁劉孝綽〈釣竿篇〉：「金轄茱萸網，銀鉤翡翠竿。」

　　「轄」還表示管轄、管束。《舊五代史‧周書‧盧文紀傳》：「時朝官分司在洛，雖有留臺御史，紀綱亦多不整肅，遂敕文紀別令檢轄。」

　　「轄」還表示車聲。《說文》：「車聲也。从車，害聲。一曰：轄，鍵也。」
humanum_short_description: 從「車」，「害」聲，表示車軸兩頭的金屬鍵，用以擋住車輪。

Chinese: You can cause harm by losing control of your car. That's why governments administer licenses for driving.
koohii1: The roads are icy, and a whole bunch of cars have spun out of control! Luckily, it was just a couple of dents; nobody was harmed.

Meaning: administer

Story: If you know how to administer control over the car, you will be safe from harm.
Kind: traditional
Lesson: 40 frameNoV4: 1552 frameNoV6: 1672 Strokes: 17 Jouyou Grade: JH JLPT: 1

從「 車 」，「 害 」聲，表示車軸兩頭的金屬鍵，用以擋住車輪。《左傳‧哀公三年》：「校人乘馬，巾車脂轄。」 「 轄 」也指魚竿釣輪軸端的金屬鍵。南朝梁劉孝綽〈釣竿篇〉：「金轄茱萸網，銀鉤翡翠竿。」 「 轄 」還表示管轄、管束。《舊五代史‧周書‧盧文紀傳》：「時朝官分司在洛，雖有留臺御史，紀綱亦多不整肅，遂敕文紀別令檢轄。」 「 轄 」還表示車聲。《說文》：「車聲也。从車，害聲。一曰：轄，鍵也。」
From " car", the sound of " harm" indicates that the metal keys at both ends of the axle are used to block the wheels. "Zuo Zhuan‧ Ai Gong Three Years": "School people ride on horses, caring for cars." " Administration" also refers to the metal key on the shaft end of the fishing rod. The Southern Dynasties Liang Liu Xiaochuo's "Fishing Rod Article": "Golden Juyu Net, Silver Hook Jade Rod." " Jurisdiction" also means jurisdiction and control. "The History of the Old Five Dynasties‧The Book of Zhou‧Lu Wenji Biography": "The official branch office of the time was in Luo. Although there were official historians in Taiwan, most of the Ji Gang did not purge, so the edict ordered the prosecution." " Ju" also means the sound of cars. "Said Wen": "The sound of the car. From the car, the sound is bad. One said: Jurisdiction, key."

轄字的基本解释

轄
xiá
见“辖”。

轄字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xiá］
［《廣韻》胡瞎切，入鎋，匣。］
［《廣韻》苦蓋切，去泰，溪。］
“辖1”的繁体字。亦作“鎋1”。亦作“1”。
(1)车轴两头的金属键，用以挡住车轮，不使脱落。
(2)指鱼竿钓轮轴端的金属键。
(3)卡，夹。
(4)管辖；管束。
(5)《汉书·游侠传·陈遵》：“遵耆酒，每大飲，賓客滿堂，輒關門，取客車轄投井中，雖有急，終不得去。”后因用以表示挽留。
(6)清朝指管辖边疆的驻札大臣的官位。
(7)古星名。
[②]［hé］
［《集韻》何葛切，入曷，匣。］
“辖2”的繁体字。
见“輵2轄”。

轄字的康熙字典解释

【酉集下】【車字部】　轄； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页1247第32
【廣韻】胡瞎切【集韻】【韻會】下瞎切【正韻】胡八切，?音鎋。【說文】車聲也。一曰鍵也。【韻會】車軸端鍵。【釋名】轄，害也。車之禁害也。【左傳·襄三十一年】巾車脂轄。【註】巾車，車官。塗脂其轄，以利轉也。　又星名。【晉書·天文志】轄星傅軫兩旁，主王侯。左轄爲同姓，右轄爲異姓。　又提轄，宋官名。　又【集韻】苦會切，音?。車聲。　又【集韻】【韻會】?何葛切，音曷。輵轄，轉搖貌。詳前輵字註。　【正字通】轄，一作鎋，鎋猶管也。轂空，裹之以金，如管也。管轄之義取此。　又與?同。【左傳·昭二十五年】昭子賦車轄。【詩·小雅】作?。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［xiá］
["Guangyun" Hu blindly cut, enter the horse, box. ]
["Guangyun" bitter cover and cut, go to Tai, Xi. ]
The traditional characters of "Jun 1". Also known as "鎋1". Also known as "1".
(1) The metal keys at both ends of the axle are used to block the wheels and prevent them from falling off.
(2) Refers to the metal key at the shaft end of the fishing rod.
(3) Cards, clips.
(4) Jurisdiction; control.
(5) "The Book of Han · The Legend of Ranger · Chen Zun": "Zun Qijiu, every big drink, the guests are full, the door is closed, the passenger car is thrown into the well, although there is a hurry, you can't go there." .
(6) The Qing Dynasty refers to the official position of the ministers stationed in Zhasa who governed the border areas.
(7) Old star name.
[②]［hé］
["Jiyun" He Geqie, Entering, Xie. ]
The traditional characters of "Hub 2".

Name meaning

xiá, hé
вм. 辖
Radicals: 車, 宀, 生, 口  (car, roof, life, mouth)
Meaning Mnemonic
When you drive a car, everyone under your roof is putting their life in your hands, even if they don't say it with their mouth—it's still under your control.
It's really important to remember how many things are under your control when you operate a vehicle. It isn't just the people in your car either, it's everyone and everything in your way too.
Reading Mnemonic
You have to maintain control of your car or you'll hit a bunch of cats (かつ). The roads are full of cats at all times. And if you lose control of your car for just a second, you'll hit at least two or three cats.
If you don't want to think about hitting adorable cats with your car, you better maintain control. You're responsible!
